bibl.title: Letter from Marie D. Gorgas to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 19, 1925

div1.p: Marie Gorgas writes to Kean that she regrets his disapproval of her biography of William Crawford Gorgas. [Kean] appends a note chastising the authors of the biography for failing to correct errors called to their attention six months before publication.

div1.head: Letter from Marie D. Gorgas to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 19, 1925
div1.p:
Your letter, and the copy
of the Military Surgeon for March
which you were kind enough to
send me, have been received. Accept
my thanks for both.

I regret that his biography does
not meet with your approval.
div1.closer:
Sincerely- Marie D Gorgas March the Nineteenth
1925
The most culpable part of the
errors made by the authors in
their Life of Wm C. Gorgas
was that they made no effort
to correct them in the period
of six months or more between
the publication of their article
in the World's Work for April 1924
and the appearance of their book
at the end of the year- The lack of
any promise of correction in Hendricks
letter of April 14 caused the publications
in the N. Y. Times of April 27- 1924
Though this publication was made
the excuse for not publishing my
letter to him of April 10, it certain-
ly was no excuse for perpetuation of
these misstatements in book form-
The end result was their exposure in the
review in the Military Surgeon, March, 1925
